case.name: Fernando v Minister for Immigration and Citizenship (No 2) [2008] FCA 1216 (13 August 2008)

citphrases.citphrase: the court appointed a barrister to act as tutor to the applicant on the grounds of the applicant's mental incapacity
the barrister agreed to accept appointment as tutor on a pro bono basis
whether the court should depart from the usual rule as to costs

citances.sentence: 4 After the appointment of Mr Ley as tutor for Mr Fernando, the originating application was amended. On 13 August 2008, I dismissed the application on the basis that the Federal Court did not have jurisdiction to hear and determine the application ( Fernando v Minister for Immigration and Citizenship (No 2) [2008] FCA 1216). I said that I would hear the parties on costs.
